website_summaries.verdict: While inexpensive, this boot gets praise for its comfort and looks.
pros: Gets high marks for looks and support
Comes in dark brown or black
cons: Some quality issues crop up after a few months, particularly with the seams and soles

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Harvey shoes  come through for me.  Shoes are drying out after water and mud.  Cleaned up easily
customer_reviews.text: I am in Houston. We are in the midst of hurricane Harvey. All I had to wear were flip-flops and tennis shoes. I remembered my new Sketchers and put them on with some thick socks. They fit great for the first time on! They protected my feet and was able to get out in horrible weather. Needed to get out in the rain and mud to inspect my property. Everything was intact. Was very pleased with my new shoes. Would definitely recommend them and buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Edmund

customer_reviews.title: BROKE SHOES
customer_reviews.text: Buy these shoes on October 17 and with normal use go to work the shoe has broken, I have images ... it is not fair that with 2 weeks of use the shoe is broken ... I expect an answer on this. Thank you! Jose Rondon jfrondon26@gmail.com joserondon26@hotmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Fit very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for working in the yard, but after I got them they really fit well and my wife said they look too nice for yard work. So I wore them to work as a pharmacy tech all day and was pleasantly surprised how comfortable they were, no blisters or sore feet. So I guess I will look for something cheaper for the yard and make these my work shoes.
customer_reviews.author: robert e

customer_reviews.title: solid well made work shoes that take a beating.
customer_reviews.text: i love these shoes i had 1 pair that i wore into the ground. they never came apart or blew out in the toe area or any thing i used mink oil on them right away so i think that helped them to last a long time. also none of the eyelets tore out like some other crappier shoes i own. i will be buying another pair really soon so i have a pair well into the future. these are very heavy duty for shoes the next level up would be a good quality pair of work boots. i am in my shoes at work for some days 14 hours and these are still some what comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: yanko ban

customer_reviews.title: This is true quality Sketchers make a great shoe not only for comfort but style but I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is true quality Sketchers make a great shoe not only for comfort but style but I always buy because of the comfort for my feet but I bought these boots for my son and the job he does requires him to stand on his feet since he has been wearing them he loves them he said it helps and his feet and ankles doesn't bother him as much while standing thanks Sketchers again oh to who ever buys make sure to buy your true size because it will be to big if u don't
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heel linings worn through in a dozen wearings.
customer_reviews.text: My last pair of this same boot were excellent. Wore them in to the ground over many years. This pair, the heel linings wore all the way through in about a dozen uses, in an office nonetheless. Skechers said to ship back at my expense. Nope, not gonna do that so tried a Skechers store. No go there either, would not take them back. They are now in a garbage receptacle at 12 Oaks Mall. Too bad, sorry Skechers, last time I buy your brand.
customer_reviews.author: RaceReadyJ

customer_reviews.title: Great boot; third pair I’ve purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair that I’ve purchased; they’re great boots. Like other Skechers, they fit true to size, and are comfortable. The uppers are a high quality, tough leather, with a durable fabric lining. The soles have a “waffle” type tread, for great grip, and they wear like iron. I use mine to walk my dogs on asphalt roads, with no accelerated appearance of wear. I also like the ankle-height of these boots. Great support. I tend to wear these boots a couple times a week, and doing that I easily get ten years of service from them.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J

customer_reviews.title: This things are horrible
customer_reviews.text: They were very uncomfortable. The point where the shoes bend just under the toes were digging into my foot causing a cut. They are hot as hell in the summer and your feet will freeze in the winter. The "leather" started peeling away soon after purchase and eventually the soles cracked. I would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon S.

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!!!
customer_reviews.text: The top of both boots are bent inward and literally cut my feet. Very uncomfortable and cannot wear them. I have an old pair, like 10 years old that are great but not these kind.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: these are good work boots for my job
customer_reviews.text: I work in an area, on concrete, that gets wet sometimes. Has some hazards from chemicals, falling boxes, and need to climb step ladders. Some low cut but a real boot. Almost everything else had lace loops up the boot, but cheapo open hooks the last lace positions-which endlessly came undone. For low boots this is unworkable! And unforgivable. These Sketchers have lace eyelets up to the top-perfect. They fit as expected. Soles rugged with good safety grip. They are comfortable, sturdy, and reasonably water-resistant. Seems almost all low boots now are made by people who NEVER wear them. Wrong way to design something. These are "just enough" across the board for my use. They are also pretty comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: These are beyond perfect! Having flat feet and a bad ankle it is hard to find supportive shoes. Some reviewers said the sizing was off. I wear a 9.5 wide in womens and ordered 7.5WW and they fit perfect with socks! This is the first "work" boot that fit perfectly and was comfortable from the first time I wore them. And the price? You cannot find footwear that is supportive and comfortable much less for under $50! (No, I was not given these for a positive review. ;-) )
customer_reviews.author: Joan S

customer_reviews.title: This Shoe Is A Chunk (which is a good thing)
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. Was looking for something between a work shoe and hiking boot. This shoe fits the bill perfectly. It’s big and relatively heavy but that’s what I wanted. Aggressive tread, well built but still low cut like a shoe. Easily adds an inch to your height. I got the “extra wide” which I think equates to a EE. At first it felt a little stiff but after just one day, started breaking in nicely. Did I mention I love this shoe?
customer_reviews.author: The Magician

customer_reviews.title: Not as well made as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The back on the shoe collapsed right away, and now the soles are coming unglued. These were a Christmas gift, so only have been worn for a little over a month, and not even every day due to the issue of the back of the shoe crunching down. Very disappointed in what I expected from Sketchers!!! I’m going to contact Amazon and see if they can help due to the return window being closed.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Read this review 3 months in
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with this s bit because I love there shoes so much but they should stay out of the boot same, first trying to understand a definition a purpose for this particular boot no good out doors and they don't really hold up to interior use, I stopped wearing outside after 1 snowfall and feet where saturated, even with wearing them cautiously somehow there is a hole in the center of the soul of the boot, the $22 dollar Amazon sneakers I bought took more of a beating and lasted twice as long, I guess these are not really boots spend more get quality waste of $50
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyramon

customer_reviews.title: I'm buying a 2nd pair in case they stop making them!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you enough how well I like these shoes. They are nice to look at, go with everything I wear, are the perfect fit and put a little spring in my step. I wear these at work and my day consists of back and forth trips to and from my office to the shop floor. I usually do about 3 to 5 miles of walking a day but you wouldn't know it with these on my feet. These are very comfortable and I am going to buy another pair just in case they stop making them. ;c )
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Exercise lol
customer_reviews.text: I use to wear size 14 in Skechers because my foot was too fat. Now since I've have lost a lot of weight. I have had to down size and 13 m in this shoes size fits perfectly. I'm very happy with this shoe. I am at nice body weight and I really like this shoe and how the difference fits well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo P. Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: causes blisters
customer_reviews.text: Worn 5 times a week for 4 mos. to go to dog park for 20 mins. of walking. Inside stitching causes ridge and blister bad enough that bled through sock and onto shoe. Very heavy shoe as well and the sole collects rocks and dirt. Better off to get some steel toed boots. Guess we are out $63.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA BOOTH

customer_reviews.title: Love these work shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have had an issue with the comfort or durability of the shoes I use to work around the house, mostly yard work. I ordered the wide shoes as my feet are tight in most D width shoes. Although slightly larger than I wanted, they still fit well and are very comfortable. I just wear two pair of socks and the shoes fit and I walk nominally 10,000 steps doing my yard work each week and these shoes are both comfortable and safe. I only have them for 3 weeks or so therefore cannot speak to longevity, but so far so very good. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Fits and Feels like a Shoe Box
customer_reviews.text: No arch support, very boxy feel, looks okay. The first time I put one on I had to double check I didn’t put the box on by accident. They are very roomy. I normally wear extra wide athletic shoes, but I should have only ordered the regular size instead. There is no surrounding cushion like material. Literally feels like I’m walking with a well made, stiff cardboard box with plywood wood bottom on my feet. I might be able to make them more wearable with thick socks and thick arch support inserts. Can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stupac

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and good fit. Walked in them all day and did not get blisters. I wear heavy socks with them. I do not have a wide foot - this truly is a med width fit.
customer_reviews.author: mk48169

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great medium working / hiking boots. - 1 star because The laces that come with them are massive, and if you buy new ones using the shoe lace guide they provide they will always be way to long for these boots. The laces are so long, that I have to lace them threw the holes twice and they still drag the ground after I tie them. Until I was injured at work. I was putting 19-27 miles on these a day, and they would hold up about a year.
customer_reviews.author: tj_M

customer_reviews.title: Not a work boot.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be more of a work boot, it is not. Very thin leather and the lack of a tongue, which dug into the top of your foot, caused me to return these. I only wore them for a couple of minutes in my home and they weren't a bad shoe, just not a work boot. I thought about keeping them and wearing them for something other than work, but I have other shoes for that.
customer_reviews.author: S-

customer_reviews.title: Versitle business-casual look
customer_reviews.text: Well made, fit as expected, good looking, and comfortable. What more can you ask of a shoe :) The sole is a little thicker than other shoes I have and I like that; it gives them a bit more rugged appearance, and a little height boost. They look good with jeans or casual pants, cargo pants, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: I returned this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I returned this shoe because the sole was as stiff as a board. Where the uppers was sown to the side, there was a bulge that hurt my foot. I put them on and took about 10 steps and knew they would be returned. Overall, the shoe is not comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jake the Snake

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. They seem tight at first but they stretch in a few days. I’m hard on work shoes and yet these last me about a year. I will continue to buy them although my next pair I may go with the wide because they do seem snug on sides of feet. Great shoe though, very good quality leather. I use mink oil on mine several times throughout the year to help keep them waterproof and preserve and soften the leather.
customer_reviews.author: teamsterusmc

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Use these to do yard work daily. Have had a few months and they are still in good condition. I can see why some said they are too nice to do work in them. Could be a nice casual boot too. These were so good, bought a pair for my son. He is a car mechanic. On his feet all day. Started his new job and after 1st week had blisters all over his feet. Bought these and the blisters cleared up. He loves them. Great price and comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Todd M. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Extra Wide is the key!
customer_reviews.text: I have a left foot that is much larger than my right foot. My quest for the right shoes has been going on for over 2 years. These shoes are so wonderful because they are not just extra wide, but they are taller too. This enables me to loosely tie the laces on my left and to tightly tie the laces on my right. They are so comfortable that my day goes better. I was so blessed to find them. Don't nobody touch my Mariner Utility Boots!
customer_reviews.author: Voiceknight

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots/Shoes that require a good Break-in
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Work Boots/Shoes. These are Oiled Leather that helps to repel water. They will need additional time to be properly broken in before actual usage since they are manufactured with a very Stiff and High Treaded Sole, which is a plus on uneven rocky ground and even snow? The size is excellent since it has the room for wearing thick cold weather socks with ease, I'm talking Northeast action here. I've owned new boots that had stiff soles in the past, but with a little time and dedication they became a favorite, hopefully this will be the case with these....I hope?
customer_reviews.author: M. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Best boots under 100 bucks ive found in a long time. Will buy these again
customer_reviews.text: Ive never felt more like gene simmons in my life until i put these boots on. You can feel the temperature change once you get up there in these. And honestly, you can step on a volkswagon and not even realize it was there. Perfect for walking on gravel or big rocks. They held up great considering i work around gas and oil every day. I sprayed them with camp dry one time and they lasted about 7 months or so. Picture shown is the last day i wore them
customer_reviews.author: Mike Moose

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to break in
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots to replace Timberland boots that had just worn out. These are stiff. It took several weeks to break in - starting off with using them in stirrups on horseback then on rugged ground on the ranch. I bought inserts because of lack of arch support and they were hard on the bottom of my feet. That helped improve support and comfort. The boots are good looking and rugged. I put water repellent on them and they worked well in the snow and slush. All in all, they are not comfortable but they will take a lot of abuse and still keep looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer Down

customer_reviews.title: Quality uppers; soles not up to snuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots in mid-July and have been putting about 4 miles per day on them - walking sidewalks. The entire sole and especially the heels of both boots showed extensive wear after what I would consider to be moderate use. The local cobbler has replaced both soles with vibram name brand soles and now the boots are what they should have been in the first place. However, custom cobbler work is not cheap!
customer_reviews.author: nong fu

customer_reviews.title: Hurts front of my ankle
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes brand new and I've got a red sore mark on my ankle. The second time I wore the shoes, I had to have them on too loose so it wouldn't hurt my ankle. The size is correct, but it's just not a comfortable shoe. In comparison, the Lugz brand shoe of the same style was very comfortable. I'll change this review if this shoe just needs to be broken in and it starts feeling better.
customer_reviews.author: Hirschel Litzenbaum

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Work Boot Ever
customer_reviews.text: I took a leap of faith and ordered these online sight unseen based on price and features. I've been very pleasantly surprised at the quality and comfort. Nice leather uppers, deep waffle tread, good laces, good looking, and the fit is as expected. The only thing I didn't love was the lack of a cushy insole, but that was easily remedied for a few bucks. I'm loving these and am finding lots of reasons to wear them. Really happy!
customer_reviews.author: Knotscott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Work Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I knew Sketchers had a good reputation as a sneaker but didn't know they made a work model. I admit I was skeptical when reading all the very positive reviews. Decided to give them a try and was glad I did. Fit was a fraction loose but heavier socks resolved that. Very comfortable and are holding up well to yard and light construction work. I'll buy them again when these eventually wear out but they're holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: dBlues

customer_reviews.title: order 1/2 size smaller than you typically are
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9.5 in every shoe I put on. On the rare occasion that a shoe doesn't fit me, it is too small. This shoe was too big by 1/2 size. I recommend you buy 1/2 smaller than you typically are. I returned them, they are very nice looking and if they fit me properly, probably would have been OK comfort wise, though they are stiff, which you'd expect out of this type of work shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: Owned and have worn these boots for awhile now. I needed wide shoes for work that wouldn't exacerbate my gout. Rains a lot where I live so wanted a every day boot that could handle puddles and mud. These worked out great. These feel a bit large on my feet. But may just be me as this was my first extra wide boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... but I was looking for a boot that looked good and was comfortable and this one is it
customer_reviews.text: I don't work in construction but I was looking for a boot that looked good and was comfortable and this one is it. Lengthwise it fits perfect. There is some space between the top of my foot and the boot but I like that because I like to add insoles to all my shoes to make them more comfortable since I am on my feet all day. I also wear them anytime I am going to ride my bike. They are not water proof but I took care of that with Kiwi spray that I found at walmart. I do recommend these boots for casual dress and light work outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Orencio Medina Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing comfort and Arch support!
customer_reviews.text: I struggle to find work shoes that hurt my feet. I have bought countless pairs of work boots, and by the end of the first week, I can't wear them anymore. These Skecher Mariner Shoes are absolutely amazing! I did not expect for Skechers to have a quality work shoe that was comfortable, and supportive. I have plantar fasciitis and the insole of the Sketcher shoe is thick and comfortable. I can't say enough about how great these shoes are, and for the price, they are unbeatable. Take the chance, order them - you won't regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: music2jenn

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected, not the most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The quality seems good but the shoe seems to run about half to a full size larger than other shoes so take this into account when you order. They look good and are quiet (I keep having issues with shoes being "loud" when I walk". They are stiff so keep this in mind the first time you put them on. They break in after about 7 full days of use. The comfort is "meh" at best. I wish it had better cushioning in the sole and shoe and the back heal.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good warm sturdy low ankle boots.
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a man's boot, I ordered it with the expectation of it being sturdy and comfortable. I don't regret making my purchase. It's warm, comfortable and the fit is good for my feet. I can wear thick socks and still be comfortable. I wore them on a very cold day, 25 degrees, and my feet stayed warm. I was outdoors for almost an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gibson

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: I now trust Sketchers "wide fit" enough to order new shoes, online. So that being said, they fit my 4E wide fred flinstone feet fine. What I dont like about them is they are cut off at an odd spot right below the ankle bone and that kinda rubs me the wrong way. If I didnt dislike that I would give them a five.
customer_reviews.author: avanzee

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Skechers quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who goes through shoes at an insane rate due to working in the construction field. Usually the toes of his shoes are coming up after a month - but not Skechers! These in particular have been very sturdy and comfortable, I would imagine they might last forever under "normal" wear conditions. Happy to have found a shoe that we can get some more wear out of before replacing. He likes them so much he wants a second pair for around the house/going out.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: the only work shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plumber/ HVAC guy for over 30 years now. I walk on average 5 miles a day working (per phone) this is the 27th pair I bought. to put it simply I get 3000 miles out of a pair (3 months) before the soles wear out that out performs chippeawa, red wing, carolina, dunham, or any other work shoe for 3 times the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: This are great shoes. This is the 3rd pair of these. My first two have lasted more than 10 years and still good for non work shoes. They fit like a glove and offer excellent support, Zero foot, knee or back pain. Very durable. I will be ordering another pair while they are still available just because I don't like shopping for my picky feet. TEN STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nice and wide as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable right out of the box, a bit stiff, but the sole feels good and solid. I expect they will break in and be fine. If they last that is the true test. Sketchers seems to be in touch with my expectation of a 2X wide.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first one lasted a few years before the seams split and the whole shoe essentially fell apart. This one has lasted about 7 months even wearing them only 3 hours a day. The black rubber heel on one shoe has shredded with only a fraction of an inch remaining. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Joe

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION !!  DANGEROUS  !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes last spring so I never got to try them on ICE. Just wore them the first time in cold weather. IF YOU LIVE WHERE IT GETS BELOW FREEZING -- DO NOT BUY THESE SHOES !! -- YOU WILL FALL. The soles are so slick on Ice that you cannot stand up. I had to immediately take them off. Too late to send them back so I guess they will be my summer shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Rosen

customer_reviews.title: looks good with with a pair of jeans or can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding boot for all occasions, looks good with with a pair of jeans or can be worn with khakis. Received quickly and the fit was perfect, was a little appreciative, usually boots run a bit bigger but these fit perfect. Only negative is that these can not be worn during any type of heavy construction, but that’s not what they were designed for, would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Good looking boot, but....
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of Skechers for work over the years, and I have to say these are no where near as comfortable as others. There seems not to be any padding, so comfort is not there. I wished I had went to a store and tried these on first, then I would have looked around for something else. Really disappointed. These might be good for someone else, but my advise is to find them somewhere you can actually try them on first.
customer_reviews.author: brian winton

customer_reviews.title: These are made like the $20 Payless shoes I refuse to buy
customer_reviews.text: Sketcher in name only. These are made like the $20 Payless shoes I refuse to buy. I got screwed for $60 on these. They hurt the tops of my feet, so in the trash they went. No padding in the bottoms either, not for walking. So mad right now.
customer_reviews.author: dwe

customer_reviews.title: Good boots for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are nice heavy duty shoes they don't have soft soles they are very firm like most boots. They look great fit as expected. They are heavy like most boots I'm satisfied and they are what I expected there pretty heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: John benoit

customer_reviews.title: I bought these a little big both because it's nostalgic ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a little big both because it's nostalgic for when I used to buy big boots as a teenager for comfort but also because it already protects at the ankles. So having that bonus support and room for comfort are a collective win/win.
customer_reviews.author: John Wright

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, order a half size down!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these wide...and they are extremely wide! I would recommend people to order a half size down when ordering a wide shoe in this brand. The look and the feel are quality. It's just the shoe size I ordered seem too large. The only reason i gave a 3 star was because of the size. It's a pain to return so i will deal with the big shoe.
customer_reviews.author: j lo

customer_reviews.title: Failed where comfort counts
customer_reviews.text: Skechers Men's Mariner Utility Boot: I like the outer of this shoe which is very durable and has an outstanding sole. However, the inside where comfort counts they are a failure. The entire lining in the back of both shoes failed at the same time after just five months of wear. These shoes are used for about six hours five days a week inside a clean and dry environment.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: Great work boot!
customer_reviews.text: I work on ladders for many hours a day, so good support and comfortable shoes are a must. This boot did not disappoint. I stopped having trouble with my feet once I started wearing these to work. This is my second pair to purchase, as I wanted them in different colors. I recommend these for anyone who needs good support and are on their feet a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Nichols

customer_reviews.title: 1st time buyer of Sketchers & I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone asks where I got them & says they really like em. I should've bought 2 pairs as my feet sweat & it'd be nice to let em dry out more than just overnight w/ cedar socks in to dry em out inside. 1st time owning a pair of Sketchers &can say I will buy again w/o a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Finally a boot for my son!
customer_reviews.text: My son's feet are sized 14. This is a size that is almost impossible to find on the store shelves so I always have to order online. I am so happy with these boots! They fit perfectly, look great and keep his feet warm during our cold and snowy winters. This is a quality boot at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my husband for work. The price was right. My husband is a plumber and some how destroys shoes. They never last him but a few months tops. These shoes lasted him just shy of a year. They are pretty well made and look good. They are shorter than a typical boot but higher then a shoe so they have ankle support. They are easy to get in and out of. I highly recommend them and would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Honumoon

customer_reviews.title: These are not boots
customer_reviews.text: This product is listed as a boot. It is a shoe, not a boot. The collar comes up to just below my ankle bone. My definition of a boot is footwear that comes up to at least over the ankle. It will definitely require breaking in before I can wear them for long walks with my dog. I have not had a chance to see how waterproof these are.
customer_reviews.author: SSG Cedar

customer_reviews.title: Definitely wide shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoe / boots, my husband has trouble finding brands of shoes that are wide enough and comfortable. So usually he sticks to new balance & timberland. He agreed to give these a try. He usually wears a 9 1/2 but we had to exchange for a 9 because the 9 1/2 was too big. The 9 was just right and after wearing them a while he told me he liked them 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: S.K

customer_reviews.title: Other Reviews true
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you read a review and wonder if it is true. Well, The rivet does dig into my foot and makes it quite uncomfortable to wear. Also, the tongue of the boot is quite stiff making it dig into my ankle as I walk. Unacceptable and time will not heal but actually cause wounds, RETURNED.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Abercrombie

customer_reviews.title: I’m about to buy another pair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes November of 2018. It’s currently June 25th 2019. I work between 45-55 hours and these shoes have lasted. I work in wet locations often and on concrete too. My feet have gotten wet but that to me is part of the job. Leather and sole face held up nicely. But a few months ago the laces started to separate and then break. That would be my only complaint to date. I wish I could thank Sketchers for making such a great shoe. A steel toe would make it better. But just be careful.
customer_reviews.author: fizzledust

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work in a wet environment. They kept my feet dry and seemed to fit well. The only problem I had was that the tounge of the shoe would shift to the side and Bunch up when I walked. This caused pain on the top of my foot until I moved the tounge back. It would bunch up again after a short time. I had to stop using them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend for work
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage, after just 2 and a hlaf months or use in a commercial kitchen these are not wearable. They are not slip resistant by any means, or even slightly water resistant. A single drop of water on the tongue or laces and the moisture goes straight to my to my toes. There is minimal support from my big to all the way to my heal. I expect a refund and will update this review pending the sellers response to my request. Would not recommend. Should have stuck with SFC’S nonslips
customer_reviews.author: timothy v.

customer_reviews.title: I'll buy again 4 sure as a work shoe
customer_reviews.text: Us in as a work boot. Mind you my company provides us with redwing steel toes every year or as needed. Red wing is a quality work boot but for the money plus I like to look good even in work boots these are extremely comfortable with no break in period. 10x more comfy than my timberlands. Very good grip I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: For Me, By themselves "Okay", With Added Insoles, Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was a little loose for me but good insole inserts took care of that at about $18. Now I am on ladders and walking a job site with less heel pain. I'd give it 3.5 stars as they are a bit heavy compared tio other shoes but then they are work shoes. Hmmm...
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Nice winter shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a comfortable winter shoe that I could wear in a casual office setting so I purchased Skechers. They are slightly heavy however you get use to them. I feel the Skechers Marine are nice to look at and comfortable when walking around the office. Plus, the go well with a nice pair of jeans... I love them.
customer_reviews.author: TWest

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoes - but caveat
customer_reviews.text: Skechers USA Men's Mariner Utility Boot. Well made and very comfortable; however, beware the rubber logo they have sewn in to the shoe's tongue. It is of a material that looks like a plastic or rubber, and it will NOT allow the laces to slid over when lacing up the shoes. This is a nuisance. I thought the issue would resolve with use, but it has not. I have to pull up each lace and then pull down to tie the laces. A real nuisance. Otherwise, good shoes. Nice thick soles and heels, and good quality construction. Just wish they had made their logo out on some other material, like leather?
customer_reviews.author: J. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair Of Work Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband 2 months ago. He's a cabinet maker and works 10 hour days. He wears a size 12 and is normal weight. He's literally on his feet the entire time--no sitting down. He's 53 years old and does get tired by the end of the day. However, he says his shoes feel great and his feet never hurt despite the long hours. So I'm thrilled. He does use a pair of gel inserts to enhance his comfort even more. He gets these things wet and dusty, and they still look fine. The soles are heavy, the fit is perfect, and the support is superb. We're gonna be purchasing another pair next year.
customer_reviews.author: MizJones

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great durable shoes. This is my 2nd pair after the rubber indentations on the sole wore all the way down on the others after over a year. The soles would definitely last longer normally, but I put them through more use than most people would though working two jobs with a lot of walking. Working 60 to 70 hour weeks plus wearing them outside of work they always felt good and didn't leave my feet hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: My all time favorite winter boot/shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Skechers Mariner shoe/boot. I only wear them in the winter and like to replace them every 3 years, so they look good for work (Business casual). My feet stay warm and dry if I have to walk through snow or rain. After wearing them for a week I noticed my legs and back did not ache, I think the thicker rubber is a better cushion then my normal work shoes. I hope Skecher never stops making this style.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I add Riemot brand memory foam inserts with Happy feet arch support over that (totals half inch thick). This boot has the room above the foot to do that. The actual boot is nice and light. I can't speak to its comport due my alterations. But after my inserts are In, these boots are fire.
customer_reviews.author: Boke Jones

customer_reviews.title: great shoe for the money
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit good and look to be well made. just what i expected from sketchers . Could use a little more cushion in them for my liking. I just added a wedge insert to fix that. They are water proof as stated. I have wore these shoes several days for about 12 hours a day and will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Very good indeed
customer_reviews.text: The first two days these are not comfortable as they adapt to your feet. After the first couple of days these are very easy to put on and wear. Excellent. Plus they're not as "clunky" as most work-boots and hit a happy medium in my warehouse duties.
customer_reviews.author: K. Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are sturdy enough without resorting to steel toe boots. I am still breaking them in. I bought these for slogging around the yard, working in the garden with a rototiller, general greenhouse construction, and while I was cutting up overgrown bushes and trees on my property. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Shel

customer_reviews.title: Shoe sizes seem to be smaller than in the past
customer_reviews.text: Shoes sizes seem to be smaller than in the past. I used to be able to wear 10 1/2 to 11 sizes, but last 3 pairs I have purchased, I have had to use size 12. I reordered the same shoe in size 12. They seem to be fine, but I did add sole inserts for working on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Boston

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking.  Fit big.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 12 in all my other shoes. This is my first and last time buying shoes online. These shoes fit a little big on me. I can feel my foot wobbling like I'm a little boy wearing my dad's boots. I cannot recommend someone buy these online unless they've tried them on before.
customer_reviews.author: F.  Lastname

customer_reviews.title: OK, but took 2 weeks to break in
customer_reviews.text: I think they're a bit too narrow mid-foot, maybe need to be a bit taller? Also, the left show didn't flex like the right shoe and it rubbed my pinky toe. The right one was perfect. It took over 10 days, and 3 applications of Neatfoot's oil until the left show softened up and started flexing properly. Quality seems good; sole/arch support is not great. The insole material smells very chemical/rubbery; it's the only pair of shoes I own that smells like this. I would not buy them again at this cost.
customer_reviews.author: DanB

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot
customer_reviews.text: These are really a low cut boot. They have substantial weight but being a 6' 200lb man I knew that the weight was a non factor. I was glad to hold the shoe and feel that weight. I wanted a shoe rugged enough so that standing for hours at work on a concrete floor would not have my feet "talking" to me. My feet do feel better after a days work so I am a satisfied customer. It's just that simple....the wide rugged sole and the shoe being leather are what make this product perform for me.
customer_reviews.author: Henry B. Tripp

customer_reviews.title: so far so good, ask me again in a yeear
customer_reviews.text: And i'll tell you hoe they hold up. I had a similar pair of skechers for 5 years, super comfy and good traction for hiking around. They look good enough to wear to work every day too. I'm holding back a star until i see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Sketchers boot
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 14 double wide. Sketchers is the only one that fits this size. Great feeling as I wear it all day on my job and no foot pain. Keeps my foot dry at all times. I am so tired of Chinese sizes being at least a full size smaller than advertised, at least Sketchers gets the size right. Very good value,
customer_reviews.author: Russell B. Temple

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I’ve only been wearing the shoes for approximately two weeks. They feel really comfortable and fit really well. They look good and the style is nice. I like that the leather wipes off real easy. Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Size ran large for me.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look. Ordered my regular size, 11.5W. They were way too big. Returned them ordered 11.0W. They fit great except the heal. It feels like it's wide and my heal moves around in it. Going to look for a product to make it fit better. May have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sketcher work boots
customer_reviews.text: Fit and appearance are as expected from Sketcher's. I use as casual wear with jeans. I would recommend that any sketcher's shoes be ordered a 1/2 size larger then you would normally wear. I currently have seven pairs of Sketcher shoes in my daily rotation and have always been very satisfied with fit, appearance and price.
customer_reviews.author: azsnake

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: The width and toebox are perfect. There is zero arch support, but I had a pair of insoles from another pair of shoes so they’re comfortable. They are very rugged. Feels like they will need some breaking in but they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: E Kauf

customer_reviews.title: comfortable light duty
customer_reviews.text: My knees have been hurting for years. I always buy expensive made in USA boots that last for 2-3 years but are not comfortable especially on concrete floors. Bought these strictly for comfort they are sized REALLY large but once I recieved a size that fit they are super comfortable. Not really a heavy duty work boot but still not a shoe
customer_reviews.author: NATE HALL

customer_reviews.title: Good tread, bad fit
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to fit okay at first a little tight in the toe area on my right foot. By the end of the first 4 work days wearing these "extra wide" shoes my feet hurt badly and I had blisters on one foot and some trying to start on my other. Also they don't seem to grip on smooth ice at all despite an aggressive tread, almost fell in my work parking lot on a small patch of ice. I'm going to get a shoe stretcher an try to fix them but I'm not sure if it will work...
customer_reviews.author: allen H.

customer_reviews.title: Wear like Iron
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this type of shoe for over 4 years and they are worth every penny spent on them. I work in an industrial area and these shoes will wear down to a flat bottom and the uppers will still be usable and look good.If you want a work horse shoe this is the one to buy. I also use them on long walking tour we go on when we take cruises to Europe. I also use them for work and office and they look good if you clean them on occasion. You won't be sorry you bought them!!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots
customer_reviews.text: I love Skecher products and have been wearing their various shoes for years. I saw these and had to try a pair. They have a very deep lug heal and sole and are great for outdoors but they are very comfortable and light. I have a very flat foot so I put my gel orthodic inserts in these and wow, perfect fit and comfort. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: J. Knight

customer_reviews.title: happy shopper!
customer_reviews.text: I hope this pair does as good as the last pair. I finally found a product that gives my feet the support they need and don't way a ton. Clair Martin
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, very comfortable for standing and walking all day. Product not available in any local Skechers store, so I tried online and these are great!
customer_reviews.author: Act162This

customer_reviews.title: good fit, stiff leather
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, seems pretty durable so far. They are slightly uncomfortable to begin with, but fit my foot after a couple days. The leather can be a bit stiff, but i'm sure when i wear it a bit, they will be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank_Toast

customer_reviews.title: Manly -  Man boots
customer_reviews.text: i like the rugged look and feel after they get broken - in . Great work boots and ankle support. Been thru quite a few pair over the years. if the sole or heal start flappin just use some gorilla glue. great boots .. 5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Breadman

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Hard and uncomfortable no skin left on top base of my pinky toe, not sure if these are still the same as they have a lot of good reviews, but every other boot I've owned has been better than these wooden feet coffins.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna & George

customer_reviews.title: Very Roomy-almost a 5 star!
customer_reviews.text: Very Roomy. They seem to run a 1/2 size larger, but very nice work shoes. In Winter, you could double up your socks and even add inserts if necessary. One minor observation, I believe the tongue of this work shoe should be a quarter to half inch longer for ankle comfort and support. All in all, better to large than too small.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene F. White

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Fashionable.  Good for Work, Hiking, Yard Work.  My Favorite Shoe 5 Years Running!
customer_reviews.text: I never give out the 5 stars lightly. These are -by far- my favorite shoe or boot for casual wear. Classy enough to wear at the office with Khakis, but durable enough for mountain trail hiking. I probably wear my pairs 200 days a year, and they last just over a year; then I use the old pairs around the yard until they are really shot. Well-built, and a good value. They clean up well. I always get additional insoles for them to help them feel comfortable on long walks, but that may be a need based on my weight, not so much the shoe/boot. Try 'em, you'll like 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Washed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Me
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the same shoe size for many years. However, as I have grown older I need shoes that provide good support. I am very pleased with how these shoes feel on my feet. As a bonus they are nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: George Pfaffenberger

customer_reviews.title: They hurt my feet
customer_reviews.text: I wear Skechers Go Walk always and walk around 50,000 a week. I needed something to wear when it rains so I thought these would be perfect. The first rainy day , I put them on and they really hurt my feet. I couldn't wait till I got home and take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Pike P.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good light duty boot
customer_reviews.text: Really good light duty boot. Got a year out of these boots before both bottom treads split. The rest of the boot body is still in great shape, I could have possibly gotten another year out of them if the treads hadn't broke. Only con is the support, absolutely get insoles with these.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Fair for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are not good work shoes. They track in enough mud to plant a small plant which my wife does not like. You would think they would slip resistant but you would be wrong. They have very little traction once the fill up with mud. They are not warm at all and plan on buying some insoles. Other than that the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Knarf G

product_meta.title: Skechers Men's Mariner Utility Boot
product_meta.description:
You'll feel secure on land and on sea in this Mariner boot from Skechers. The extreme tread is designed to keep you upright in all types of terrain and the lugged sole provides great shock absorption. For those who have a hard time getting good fit, it offers a deep toe box and supportive instep. This is a work boot masquerading as an elegant shoe, and it seems destined to become a wardrobe favorite.

Skechers is an award-winning global leader in the lifestyle footwear industry that designs, develops, and markets lifestyle footwear that appeals to trend-savvy men, women, and children. The company's success stems from its high-quality, diversified, and affordable product line that meets consumers' various lifestyle needs. Since its inception in 1992, Skechers' diverse product offering has grown from utility-styled boots to include seven Skechers brands and five uniquely branded fashion lines for the whole family.
feature_bullets: Leather utility boot featuring lug outsole, padded collar, and logo label on tongue
Reinforced seam detail. Smooth or oiled leather upper
